thread.title: UNC women’s soccer loses to Idaho, still clinches Big Sky Conference tournament berth
thread.title_full: UNC women’s soccer loses to Idaho, still clinches Big Sky Conference tournament berth

author: Trenton Sperry TS
title: UNC women’s soccer loses to Idaho, still clinches Big Sky Conference tournament berth
text: Smaller Larger Related Media The University of Northern Colorado women’s soccer team lost to the University of Idaho 2-0 on Sunday, but clinched a berth to the Big Sky Conference tournament in early November. Idaho officially became the Big Sky regular season champions with the win and will host the conference tournament Nov. 6-9. The Bears fell behind early in Sunday’s matchup, giving up a goal to the Vandals in the fifth minute. Idaho sealed its win with a header goal from a corner kick in the 82nd minute. UNC didn’t lack for scoring opportunities. The Bears managed 14 shots — nine in the second half — and six corner kicks. UNC senior forward Essence Ortiz-Laneir had three of the Bears’ shots, while Kassy Castillo, Mariel Gutierrez, Paige Morris, Adrienne Jordan and Jacqui Pulley each had two. The Bears (6-2-1 Big Sky, 11-7-1 overall) wrap up the regular season at 2 p.m. Friday at North Dakota (2-6-1, 4-11-2). IU 1 1 — 2 Scoring — IU, 5:19; IU, 82:48. Shots (On Goal) — IU 12 (6), UNC 14 (5). Saves — IU 5, UNC (Kaitlin Ruff) 4. Corner Kicks — IU 5, UNC 6.
